components.description:
A water buffalo, a bovine used to plough rice fields in parts of Asia. Depicted in gray or black in full profile on all fours facing left, with a tail and broad horns curled up at the tips.

Often used to represent a bull. Not to be confused with üêÇ Ox, though their applications may overlap.

Microsoft’s design was previously brown.

title: Water Buffalo

version.description:
Released in October 2010, Unicode 6.0 was the first version of the Unicode Standard to support emoji.

Some characters in prior versions of Unicode were retroactively updated to provide an emoji presentation. This release was the first to introduce new characters for the sole purpose of compatability with emojis being used in Japan.

emoji_net_data.category: Miscellaneous Symbols And Pictographs -> Animal symbols
emoji_net_data.definition: A Domestic Water Buffalo, used primarily for tilling (ploughing) rice fields in parts of Asia. Water Buffalo was approved as part of Unicode http://emojipedia.org/water-buffalo/
emoji_net_data.name: water buffalo

bn:00090506v: Of a cow or bull, to make its characteristic lowing sound.
Make a low noise, characteristic of bovines

bn:00003357n: A related North American animal, the American bison, Bison bison.
A wild heavy bison of the species Bison bison, having a broad massive horned head.
A bovine mammal, a species of bison, Bison bison.

The American bison, also commonly known as the American buffalo, is a North American species of bison that once roamed the grasslands of North America in massive herds, became nearly extinct by a combination of commercial hunting and slaughter in the 19th century and introduction of bovine diseases from domestic cattle, and has made a recent resurgence largely restricted to a few national parks and reserves.
Large shaggy-haired brown bison of North American plains

bn:00006344n: The water buffalo or domestic Asian water buffalo is a large bovid found on the Indian subcontinent to Vietnam and Peninsular Malaysia, in Sri Lanka, in the Philippines, and in Borneo.
An Asian buffalo that is often domesticated for use as a draft animal
A large ungulate, widely used as a domestic animal in Asia, South America. North Africa and Europe: .
A large ungulate, widely used as a domestic animal in Asia.

bn:00059960n: Any bovine animal used as a beast of burden.
An ox, also known as a bullock in Australia, New Zealand and India, is a bovine trained as a draft animal.
Any bovine animal (tribe Bovini) used as a beast of burden
An adult castrated bull of the genus Bos; especially Bos taurus

bn:00013774n: Uncastrated adult male of domestic cattle
An adult male of domesticated cattle or oxen.

bn:00023381n: Female of domestic cattle: "`moo-cow' is a child's term"
